|years3 = 2015– |clubs3 = [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] |caps3 = 117 |goals3 = 9 |nationalyears1 = 2006 |nationalteam1 = [[France national under-18 football team|France U18]] |nationalcaps1 = 4 |nationalgoals1 = 0 |nationalyears2 = 2006–2007 |nationalteam2 = [[France national under-19 football team|France U19]] |nationalcaps2 = 14 |nationalgoals2 = 3 |nationalyears3 = 2008–2010 |nationalteam3 = [[France national under-21 football team|France U21]] |nationalcaps3 = 13 |nationalgoals3 = 0 |nationalyears4 = 2012– |nationalteam4 = [[France national football team|France]] |nationalcaps4 = 7 |nationalgoals4 = 1 |club-update = 10:44, 28 February 2019 (UTC) |ntupdate = 18:52, 25 July 2017 (UTC) }} '''Étienne Capoue''' (born 11 July 1988) is a French professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Premier League]] club [[Watford F.C.|Watford]]. He can play as either a [[Midfielder#Defensive midfielder|defensive midfielder]] or [[Defender (association football)|defender]]. Capoue was a [[France national youth football team|French youth international]] having earned caps at [[France national under-18 football team|under-18]], [[France national under-19 football team|under-19]], and [[France national under-21 football team|under-21]] level. Capoue served as [[Captain (association football)|captain]] for a portion of his stint with the latter team. He is the younger brother of [[US Boulogne|Boulogne]] player [[Aurélien Capoue]].
== Club career ==
=== Early career === Capoue was born in the [[Communes of France|commune]] of [[Niort]] in Deux-Sèvres and began his career playing for hometown club [[Chamois Niortais F.C.|Chamois Niortais]]. In 2002, he departed the club and joined FC Chauray, a local club in [[Poitou-Charentes]].<ref>{{cite news | url=http://jcs9.free.fr/affiche_articles.php?article=153 | title = Le TFC, c'est la famille! | date = | accessdate = 18 July 2010 | publisher = Jeunes Citoyens Supporters | language = French}}</ref> Capoue stayed at the club for two years before joining [[Angers SCO]] in [[Pays de la Loire]]. While playing in a youth league match against [[Toulouse FC|Toulouse]], Capoue drew the attention of the club's scouts who offered the player a one-week trial. Prior to agreeing to the internship, he was also approached by [[Lille OSC|Lille]], [[AJ Auxerre|Auxerre]], and [[FC Girondins de Bordeaux|Bordeaux]]. Capoue chose Toulouse because of the club's training facilities and the good weather.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.ladepeche.fr/article/2006/12/06/28131-TFC-Etienne-Capoue-prend-son-envol.html | title = Etienne Capoue prend son envol | date = 6 December 2006 | accessdate = 18 July 2010 | publisher = La Depeche | language = French}}</ref>
=== Toulouse === [[File:Étienne Capoue 2008-07-09.JPG|thumb|left|180px|Capoue with Toulouse in 2008]] Capoue began his club career with Toulouse in 2006 playing on the club's under-18 team. During the early portion of the [[Championnat de France amateur 2007–08|2007–08 season]], he played on the club's [[Championnat de France amateur]] team in the fourth division making eight appearances. Midway through [[2007–08 Ligue 1|the season]], Capoue was called up to the senior team by manager [[Alain Casanova]]. On 8 December 2007, he made his professional debut appearing as a substitute in a 1–0 victory over Lille.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuilleMatch.asp?saison=2007/2008&code_evt=D1&code_jr_tr=J17&num_ordre=10 | title = Toulouse v. Lille Match Report | date = 8 December 2007 | accessdate = 18 July 2010 | publisher = [[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | language = French}}</ref> The following week, Capoue made his first professional start against [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]] at the [[Parc des Princes]]. Toulouse won the match 2–1 with Capoue playing 71 minutes.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuilleMatch.asp?saison=2007/2008&code_evt=D1&code_jr_tr=J18&num_ordre=7 | title = Paris SG v. Toulouse Match Report | date = 15 December 2007 | accessdate = 18 July 2010 | publisher = [[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | language = French}}</ref>
On 7 February 2008, Capoue, along with teammate [[Cheikh M'Bengue]], signed his first professional contract agreeing to a three-year deal until 2011.<ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/20080207_173707Dev.html | title = Capoue passe pro | date = 7 February 2008 | accessdate = 18 July 2010 | publisher = [[L'Equipe]] | language = French}}</ref> For the [[2008–09 Ligue 1|2008–09 season]], Casanova paired the young defensive midfielder with former youth teammate [[Moussa Sissoko]] and new signing [[Étienne Didot]], who arrived from [[Stade Rennais F.C.|Rennes]]. The trio performed well in the midfield with Capoue flourishing making 36 total appearances. On 18 October 2008, Capoue scored his first professional goal against Bordeaux in a 2–1 defeat.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/feuilleMatch.asp?saison=2008/2009&code_evt=D1&code_jr_tr=J09&num_ordre=2 | title = Bordeaux v. Toulouse Match Report | date = 18 October 2008 | accessdate = 18 July 2010 | publisher = [[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | language = French}}</ref> During the season, he also received 14 [[Penalty card|yellow card]]s in all competitions, second to only [[Siaka Tiéné]] of [[Valenciennes FC|Valenciennes]] in the league. For his efforts, he was nominated for the [[Ligue 1 2008-09#Young Player of the Year|Ligue 1 Young Player of the Year]] award and awarded a contract extension until 2013 by his club.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.toulouse7.com/2009/11/26/sissoko-prolonge-au-tfc/ | title = Sissoko prolonge un an | date = 26 November 2009 | accessdate = 18 July 2010 | publisher = Toulouse 7 | language = French}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.rmc.fr/edito/sport/76169/capoue-en-espagne-ca-joue/ | title = En Espagne, ça joue | date = 17 April 2009 | accessdate = 18 July 2010 | publisher = Radio Monte Carlo | language = French}}</ref>
During the [[2009–10 Ligue 1|2009–10 season]], Capoue appeared regularly in the first team and drew interest from Italian club [[S.S. Lazio|Lazio]] and [[Premier League]] clubs [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] and [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11800_5617263,00.html | title = Capoue focused on Toulouse | date = 8 October 2009 | accessdate = 18 July 2010 | publisher = Sky Sports }}</ref><ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11661_4962962,00.html | title = Capoue flattered by interest | date = 23 February 2009 | accessdate = 18 July 2010 | publisher = Sky Sports }}</ref> On 26 November 2009, Toulouse responded to the interest by reaching an agreement with Capoue on a one-year contract extension until 2014.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.ladepeche.fr/article/2009/11/27/724787-TFC-prolongation-de-contrat-pour-Sissoko-M-Bengue-Capoue-et-Nounkeu.html | title = prolongation de contrat pour Sissoko, M'Bengue, Capoue et Nounkeu | date = 27 November 2009 | accessdate = 18 July 2010 | publisher = Le Depeche | language = French }}</ref> Capoue appeared in 41 total matches for the season collecting 17 total yellow cards, 13 of which came in Ligue 1, leading all players.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.lfp.fr/ligue1/stat/cartons_joueur.asp?code_type_evt=AVE&saison=2009/2010 | title = Cartons par jouer | date = | accessdate = 18 July 2010 | publisher = [[Ligue de Football Professionnel]] | language = French}}</ref>
In July 2013, Toulouse accepted a reported £9.5 million bid from [[Premier League]] side [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Cardiff City have Etienne Capoue bid accepted by Toulouse |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23479981 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=27 July 2013 |accessdate=27 July 2013}}</ref> However, personal terms were not agreed and the deal was not finalised. On 15 August 2013, he completed an €11m (£9.3m) transfer to [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/aug/09/etienne-capoue-tottenham-snubs-cardiff|title=Tottenham secure Etienne Capoue from Toulouse in €11m deal|date=9 August 2013|accessdate=10 August 2013|author=David Hytner|publisher=The Guardian}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23620554|title=Etienne Capoue: Tottenham agree £9m deal for France midfielder|date=9 August 2013|accessdate=10 August 2013|author=David Ornstein|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
=== Tottenham Hotspur === [[File:Étienne Capoue vs Arsenal - 1 September 2013.jpg|thumb|150px|Capoue playing for [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] in 2013.]] On 15 August 2013, Tottenham Hotspur officially announced the signing of Capoue. The day before the announcement of Capoue, Tottenham and France's first choice goalkeeper, [[Hugo Lloris]] told French paper L'Equipe that joining Tottenham is a big step in Capoue's career. He stated his delight to see the fellow countrymen join Tottenham.<ref>http://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/422013/Spurs-shot-stopper-Hugo-Lloris-looking-forward-to-linking-up-with-Etienne-Capoue</ref> Capoue made his debut for Spurs on 18 August 2013, replacing [[Mousa Dembélé (footballer, born 1987)|Mousa Dembélé]] in a 1–0 win away to [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] at [[Selhurst Park]].<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23653983 "Crystal Palace 0–1 Tottenham"] BBC Sport. 18 August 2013. Retrieved 20 August 2013.</ref>
=== Watford === On 6 July 2015, Capoue joined newly promoted [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] for a reported club-record transfer fee of £6.3 million (€9 million).<ref>{{cite web|title=Etienne Capoue: Watford sign Tottenham midfielder|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/33410824|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|accessdate=4 September 2015|date=6 July 2015}}</ref><ref>https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/jul/06/watford-sign-etienne-capoue-tottenham-club-record-fee</ref>
He began his second season at Watford with four goals in his first six games, including the opening goal against Manchester United in a 3–1 win at Vicarage Road and another in a 4–2 comeback win against West Ham United.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Smyth|first1=Rob|title=Watford 3–1 Manchester United|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2016/sep/18/watford-manchester-united-premier-league-live|website=The Guardian|publisher=The Guardian|accessdate=18 September 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Morgan|first1=Richard|title=West Ham United 2–4 Watford: Hornets record first Premier League win of the season|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/west-ham-vs-watford/356374|website=Sky Sports|publisher=Sky Sports|accessdate=18 September 2016}}</ref>
== International career == Capoue was eligible to play for [[Guadeloupe]], due to his father being from there.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3308130/Watford-s-Etienne-Capoue-Maybe-attitude-comes-dad-Caribbean-lazy-people.html|title=Capoue believes his 'very lazy' attitude is down to Caribbean roots|website=Mail Online|accessdate=2016-03-07}}</ref> Capoue has been active with [[France national football team|France]] on the [[France national youth football team|youth level]]. He has received caps with the [[France national under-18 football team|under-18]] and [[France national under-19 football team|under-19]] teams. Capoue made his youth international debut with the under-18 team on 14 March 2006 in a 2–1 victory over [[Germany national youth football team|Germany]].<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.fff.fr/selections/m18ans/290655.shtml | title = La France remporte la première manche (2–1) | date = 14 March 2006 | accessdate = 18 July 2010 | publisher = [[French Football Federation]] | language = French}}</ref> He finished the under-18 campaign with four appearances. He made his debut with the under-19 team at the 2006 edition of the Sendaï Cup in Japan in the opening match against the [[Tōhoku region]] national team.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.fff.fr/selections/m19ans/319328.shtml | title = Victoire pour débuter (4–1) | date = 31 August 2006 | accessdate = 18 July 2010 | publisher = [[French Football Federation]] | language = French}}</ref> In the team's next group stage match against [[Japan national football team|Japan]], Capoue scored his first youth international goal in a 3–1 victory.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.fff.fr///selections/m19ans/319919.shtml | title = Deuxième succès (3–1) | date = 2 September 2006 | accessdate = 18 July 2010 | publisher = [[French Football Federation]] | language = French}}</ref> On 23 January 2007, he scored his second under-17 goal in a 2–0 win against [[Turkey national youth football team|Turkey]].<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.fff.fr/selections/m19ans/actualite/354085.shtml | title = Joli succès tricolore (2–0) | date = 23 January 2007 | accessdate = 18 July 2010 | publisher = [[French Football Federation]] | language = French}}</ref> During [[2007 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship elite qualification|qualification]] for the [[2007 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship]], Capoue scored his only goal in a 3–1 positive result against [[Poland national under-19 football team|Poland]] in the Elite Round.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.fff.fr/selections/m19ans/actualite/375103.shtml | title = Débuts victorieux (3–1) | date = 8 May 2007 | accessdate = 18 July 2010 | publisher = [[French Football Federation]] | language = French}}</ref> At the UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship, Capoue missed the first two group stage matches, but appeared in the team final one against [[Russia national football team|Russia]] and the team's semi-final defeat on penalties to [[Spain national under-19 football team|Spain]].<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.fff.fr/selections/m19ans/actualite/387146.shtml | title = France et Russie dos à dos (0–0) | date = 21 July 2007 | accessdate = 18 July 2010 | publisher = [[French Football Federation]] | language = French}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.fff.fr/selections/m19ans/actualite/387265.shtml | title = L'Espagne rejoint la Grèce (0–0, 4 tab 2) | date = 24 July 2007 | accessdate = 18 July 2010 | publisher = [[French Football Federation]] | language = French}}</ref>
On 15 August 2012, Capoue made his debut for the [[France national football team|French senior team]] in a friendly match against [[Uruguay national football team|Uruguay]].<ref>[https://www.fifa.com/worldfootball/news/newsid=1681011.html]</ref> On 11 September 2012, he scored his first goal for France in a 3–1 [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|World Cup qualifier]] win over [[Belarus national football team|Belarus]] at the [[Stade de France]].<ref>[http://www.goal.com/en/match/88546/france-vs-belarus/report]</ref>
== Career statistics ==
